identificationModule.briefTitle: Time Restricted Eating, Eating Behaviors, and Cardiometabolic Risk in Emerging Adult Women
identificationModule.officialTitle: Time Restricted Eating, Eating Behaviors, and Cardiometabolic Risk in Emerging Adult Women

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to assess how time restricted eating interventions impact eating behaviors, diet quality, and body composition in women ages 20-29 years. Participants will be asked to limit all food and drinks (except water and some non-caloric beverages) to a 10-hour period during the day for four weeks. Participants will follow their usual eating and activity patterns for one week before starting, and follow whatever eating pattern they want for 4 weeks after finishing.

armGroups.label: Time Restricted Eating
armGroups.description: Participants will limit their eating (all food and caloric beverages) to an eating window of 10 hours per day for 4 weeks. The eating window must end by 8pm. Water and non-caloric beverages are allowed outside of the eating window. No other changes are required to the types or total amount of food eaten.

interventions.name: Time restricted eating
interventions.description: Limit food intake to 10 hours per day as described in the experimental arm section.

primaryOutcomes.description: Dutch Eating Behavior Questionnaire: Emotional Eating Subscale. This subscale is scored from 1-5, with higher scores indicating higher emotional eating.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 time points: baseline, end of 4-week intervention, end of 4-week follow up

primaryOutcomes.description: Dutch Eating Behavior Questionnaire: External Eating Subscale. This subscale is scored from 1-5, with higher scores indicating higher external eating.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 time points: baseline, end of 4-week intervention, end of 4-week follow up

primaryOutcomes.measure: Eating in the Absence of Hunger
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessed through surveys sent 5x/day asking about if food was eaten and why.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline week, weeks 1 and 4 of intervention, weeks 1 and 4 of follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: Healthy Eating Index, calculated from 3-day food records. The Healthy Eating Index is scored from 0-100, with higher scores indicating higher diet quality.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 time points: baseline, end of 4-week intervention, end of 4-week follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent body fat measured by DXA

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 time points: baseline, end of 4-week intervention, end of 4-week follow up

otherOutcomes.description: Qualitative interview to glean information on participants' subjective experience of the intervention
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: End of 9-week study (following 1-week baseline, 4-week intervention, and 4-week follow up)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Able to speak and read English
* Own a smartphone
* BMI ≥ 20 kg/m2
* Usual eating window ≥ 12 hours with the last eating occasion after 8pm on the majority of days
* Have at least a moderate baseline level of dietary restraint

Exclusion Criteria:

* Shift workers
* Being pregnant, nursing, or planning to become pregnant in the next 6 months
* Having a past or current eating disorder diagnosis
* Having a chronic medical condition (including diabetes, heart, kidney, or thyroid disease) or a condition that requires therapeutic diet or specified meal timing
eligibilityModule.genderDescription: People who identify as a woman are eligible.
